attributes.action: Reduce the age limit for unrestricted motorcycles
attributes.additional_details:
The age limit to drive HGV/LGV has been reduced from 21 to 18 years of age.
With correct training and successfully passing the driving test, an 18/19 year old may drive a vehicle exceeding 30+ tonnes.
It is impossible for an 18 year old rider to pass a test to ride an unrestricted motorcycle.

A 30 tonne HGV/LGV is considerably more dangerous than a motorcycle.

The laws do not apply to car drivers. A 17 year old could drive any car subject to being able to source insurance.

It is an unfair restrictioin to motorcycle riders.

Please revise this restriction.
At age 17, limit to 125cc for 12 months.
At 18 years of age, allow the rider to train and take a full unrestricted test. If a rider satisfies examination standards, allow them to ride with no restrictions. They will have proved themselves equally as much as a HGV/LGV driver.
